articles.author: Jason Levin
articles.description:
Lens Protocol is a decentralized social graph that allows developers to build web3 social media platforms  on the Polygon network. 
Using Lens, users can mint a profile, follow others, and create and collect posts all on-chain.
articles.title: Decentralized Social Graph Lens Protocol Goes Live

articles.author: Aleksandar Gilbert
articles.description: Cryptocurrency miners continue to pump computing power into the Ethereum and Bitcoin networks despite their tokens’ recent price drop.
articles.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Hash Rates Hit All-Time Highs Despite Bear Market

articles.author: Samuel Haig
articles.description: ConsenSys founder Joe Lubin emphasizes Eth2 scalability ahead of the first chain-merge on a public testnet planned for June 8.
articles.title: June 8 Ropsten Merge Indicates Ethereum’s PoS Transition Is On Track for Q3: Joe Lubin

articles.author: Robert Stevens
articles.description:
The world’s largest US dollar stablecoin, Tether (USDT), today announced its first attestation report in six months. The report disclosed that Tether had decreased its commercial paper holdings – short-term commercial debt – by 17% from December 2021 through March 2022, from $24.2B to $20.1B. Tether said it has decreased its commercial paper holdings by …
  Tether Has Reduced Commercial Paper Backing USDT by 20% Since April Read More »
articles.title: Tether Has Reduced Commercial Paper Backing USDT by 20% Since April

articles.author: Samuel Haig
articles.description:
Accounting firm Ernst & Young and Ethereum scaling company Polygon has launched the mainnet beta of its rollup for businesses, Nightfall. Ernst & Young (EY), one of the ‘Big Four’ financial services behemoths, started work on Nightfall in 2019 to make its customers’ Ethereum transactions private. But the company was so swamped by Ethereum’s high …
  EY And Polygon Unveil ZK and Optimistic Rollup Hybrid Read More »
articles.title: EY And Polygon Unveil ZK and Optimistic Rollup Hybrid
